definition: Designing strictly to specification without questioning or user validation

positive_examples: Spec says X so we do X
Spec-driven design delivered exactly what was specified, missing that the spec itself was wrong.
The team built exactly to spec, never noticing the spec contradicted user research findings.
Spec-driven: 'The requirements document says so' ended every discussion about user needs.
Blind implementation proceeded despite the developer noticing the spec would create usability problems.
Requirements rigidity: the outdated spec was followed even though the business context had changed.
Spec-as-gospel thinking prevented the designer from suggesting improvements to the brief.
training_hints.disambiguation: Following spec blindly, not thinking critically
